Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Kalata B7 (kB7, natural AMPs; cyclotides; flowering seed plants; XXC; 3S=S, UCBB1aB; ZZP; BBM)

Literature Information.Literature: Also, active against E.coli (MIC 160 uM), P. aeruginosa (MIC 1.25 uM), S.aureus (MIC >160 uM), C.albicans (MIC >160 uM) (Str√∂mstedt et al., 2017). NMR spatial structure of ternary complex Kalata B7/Mn2+/DPC micelle (Shenkarev ZO et al  J Inorg Biochem. 2008 May-Jun;102(5-6):1246-56). Divalent cation coordination is an invarint property of all cyclotides. Mn2+ was found to be coordinated with E7, T8, T13, and  Y15 (for details, go to the PDB).You can rotate, zoom, and view the 3D structureherein the PDB. Updated 2/2014; 8/2019; 7/2021
Literature Information.Author: Plan MR, Saska I, Cagauan AG, Craik DJ.2008
Literature Information.Title: Backbone cyclised peptides from plants show molluscicidal activity against the rice pest Pomacea canaliculata (golden apple snail).
